cards.title: Audio Library
cards.description: During the course of my school's Game Audio II class, a fellow classmate and I were tasked with the creation of a game audio library. Used a Zoom H1n microphone we recorded our sound effects using various foley sound effect techniques. These recordings were then imported into Reaper to edit our sound effects to better meet our desired effect.

cards.title: BlitzSpeeder Mix
cards.description: For my school's official highest level Game Audio class, we were tasked to craft a unique song using audio samples provided by the professor. Using Reaper and its various builtin plugins, I construced a song lasting 2 minutes in length.

cards.title: Mysterious Warehouse
cards.description: Mysterious Warehouse was a project done as an independent study for an experimental high level Audio course not yet offered by my school. Alongside one other member, we both recorded and edited foley sound effects, using Reaper as our DAW. Additional, I was the one responsible for implementing the audio components into our Unity Project.

cards.title: Alien Outbreak
cards.description: Alien Outbreak is a game I crafted alongside a team of fellow students for my school's highest level undergraduate game design course. As this class was conducted during the COVID19 Pandemic, all of the work for this project was done remotely, with some members even living off shore. Additionally, half of my team consisted of students from my school's art program as well, requiring coordination between the two sides to complete the game. As the project leader, this project truly put my team coordination skills to the test, coordinating cross team to ensure everything got completed. Besides my role as the project lead, I held may other responsibilities, such as: lead character programmer, camera programmer, art implementation, and audio implementation.

cards.title: Visual Novel MQP
cards.description: A current work-in-progress Visual Novel created for my capstone project. My responsibilities consist of writing, coding, game design, music composition, and audio engineering.
